text: A man had a horse and a donkey. And they went into the city, and the ass was weary, and said to the horse, Take a portion of my burden, if thou wilt my life. And the horse became deaf, and said nothing; and the ass fell down from the fatigue, and died there. Then the owner threw all the load on the horse, even the donkey's skin. The horse sighed and said, "What a misfortune! For not wanting to carry a light burden, I now have to carry everything, even the skin of the donkey! When you don't reach out to others, you hurt yourself.
title: El caballo y el asno
author: nan Esopo
